column4: I just installed Ubuntu 10.10, and I cannot start it. The same problem occurs when I use the LiveCD, except the problem can be solved with the LiveCD by setting the boot option acpi-off.
When I am booting the system, the screen goes blank and does not turn back on. It gets to the logon screen fine as I can hear the login sound.
Also there is no GRUB boot menu when I start the system.
sounds like a vido card issue
did you check the md5 checksums on your release ?
No, but I've had this problem with three different discs.
I never do but it sounded good hehe
Thats why it is usually called Beta , I would go back 10.4 TLS
That's why I waited for the final release.
hmm, did you check all physical connections on  your video card
There's nothing wrong with the Video card, other operating systems are working fine, and it's a laptop with Nvidia graphics.
Besides that, I'm pretty sure the system uses a software rendering system before I install proprietary drivers.
Does it work before you install the update drivers I have had that same issue
like i said I have had the same issue until I did not install proprietary drivers
How did you install proprietary drivers without a display?
I may have worded that wrong the ones that are on 10.4 iso when it would update driver to the Nvidia ones I got that issue
